snippet: As lawmakers struggle to narrow the government’s deficit, every dollar taken from a grant program counts as a budget cut, while every dollar taken from a tax credit is instead a tax increase.
abstract: Lawmakers struggling to narrow government’s deficit are fighting over whether to make cuts in tax credits or spending, given that every dollar taken from grant program counts as budget cut, while every dollar taken from tax credit is considered tax increase; economists say distinction makes little difference to overall economy.
lead_paragraph: As lawmakers struggle to narrow the government’s deficit, every dollar taken from a grant program counts as a budget cut, while every dollar taken from a tax credit is instead a tax increase.

headline.seo: Taxes, or Spending? Budget Fight in Congress Focuses on a Distinction
headline.main: Tax Credits or Spending? Labels, but in Congress, Fighting Words
headline.print_headline: Tax Credits or Spending? Labels. But in Congress, Fighting Words.
